SGA Jumper http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/...417-SGA-Jumper Edited November 6, 2014 by KHTRE
I don't see a verifiable easter egg in that video. A good modeler can make a log cabin and place it on Duna, we need coordinates.

That's all, folks!

Coordinates, please. I want to go there and live there, but I fear that this may be placed by some mod... (Hi Blizzy!)

I'd say this is down to a mod of some description.

But I'll ask for coordinates too just in case it's not.
yes coords please.
Few blooming apple trees would look more in place than wooden cabin, if you know that I mean.

Well, the video maker made a lot of effort to take out any clue from where this is ( and I find strange that he/she makes sure you can't see half of the possible panorama ... hum. More, the video is made at night, probably to make sure we can't deduct the latitude by the shadow ... ), but atleast we know the altitude : 3486/7 m ... and that there aren't any towering mountains in atleast 180Ã‚Âº of the field of view . That narrows things a lot

Edited October 27, 2014 by r_rolo1

Nice, no coordinates. Just as helpful as those two easter eggs that were on the KSP wiki, where the editor didn't give any pictures or coordinates and was very vague about what they described. Sure, you have a video, but without coordinates, we can't believe you. You didn't even zoom out a lot or go to map mode. :l
That seems more fake than the quality of this analogy.

Considering that (as a pretty bad 3d artist) I could make a log cabin of similar quality in a few hours or less, I'm gonna go ahead and assume that this is a mod of some sort.

Would be cool if it were stock, but I really rather doubt it.
Again, what are the coordinates?

"Give VGER The Information!" err... coordinates.

I have a lander in Duna Orbit, happy to reorient my mission...

Well, the video maker made a lot of effort to take out any clue from where this is ( and I find strange that he/she makes sure you can't see half of the possible panorama ... hum. More, the video is made at night, probably to make sure we can't deduct the latitude by the shadow ... ), but atleast we know the altitude : 3486/7 m ... and that there aren't any towering mountains in atleast 180Ã‚Âº of the field of view . That narrows things a lot

Not much, sadly. The ground is red, so it's not near a pole. That's something. But terrain on Duna higher than 3KM isn't exactly rare.

My money's on "hoax".

Best,

-Slashy

Edited October 27, 2014 by GoSlash27

OHEMGEE GUYS I FOUND A BILLBOARD.

My point is, very probably most likely a Kerbtown/Kerbal Konstructs thing, it's quite easy to do.

Nice, no coordinates. Just as helpful as those two easter eggs that were on the KSP wiki, where the editor didn't give any pictures or coordinates and was very vague about what they described.

Uh, care to specify what fake easter eggs were? I'm fairly sure I wasn't around by then.

Uh, care to specify what fake easter eggs were? I'm fairly sure I wasn't around by then.

http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Easter_Eggs

The supposed easter egg that is left is the last one listed for Kerbin. The other one is mentioned in the Discussion section.

And I didn't say that they were fake, just that the editor didn't give any coordinates or pictures what-so-ever.
So.. Is it real?

That seems more fake than the quality of this analogy.

You just blew my mind.

If the analogy is bad, then it matches the fakeness of the video, and thus the analogy is good, in which case the analogy is bad, in which case the analogy is good... does not compute ... Paradox detected... terminating process... infinite loop avoided.

You just blew my mind.

If the analogy is bad, then it matches the fakeness of the video, and thus the analogy is good, in which case the analogy is bad, in which case the analogy is good... does not compute ... Paradox detected... terminating process... infinite loop avoided.

Don't worry! My analogy can be both accurate and bad!

Not much, sadly. The ground is red, so it's not near a pole. That's something. But terrain on Duna higher than 3KM isn't exactly rare.

My money's on "hoax".

Mine is also in there, simply because of the way the OP made the video and the fact he didn't dropped coordinates in spoiler. In the second I base myself in my own experience, since I was one of the first people to notice the Mun arches back in the ol'days ... and everyone that seen them in the first day spontaneously gave coordinates or geographical intel to get outside confirmation of the weird things they had seen that weren't there in the previous version ( the "I'm not crazy , right?" test ). But the OP made a video where he makes sure you can't see half of the sky ( most likely where Ike is, that would be enough to know the longitude of the place ) and that the video was recorded at night ( making sure you can't deduct the latitude via solar height in the horizon ), plus he/she didn't cared to give any intel on the location ....

Yeah, you're right... It's a hoax. I was really bored. So this came up.

Edited October 29, 2014 by KHTRE
Too bad ... it would had been a good discovery it true

Yeah, you're right... It's a hoax. I was really bored. So this came up.

http://i.imgur.com/orkznjN.jpg

Why would you do this?! You really shouldn't get peoples' hopes up about an "Easter egg" that you lied about. Come on, man!

...sigh...

Why would you do this?! You really shouldn't get peoples' hopes up about an "Easter egg" that you lied about. Come on, man!

...sigh...
Are you going to upload this cabin?
